section.title: Known Issues
section.para: This document details known issues with this release and any workarounds that can be applied. Please report any other issues to your &COMPANY_NAME_SHORT; support representative.

entry.para: Users of the First Version of a Dynamic Desktop Image Will Be Prompted to Restart Each Time Their VM Boots
Issue: Due to new hardware being made available to the VM when a dynamic desktop is created, a reboot is required to ensure the proper device drivers are installed and configured.

Workaround: The author of the dynamic image should publish a second version after they have completed a clean reboot and the prompt to restart no longer appears. This ensures all required device drivers are properly configured in the VM before it is made available to users.
Issue: The &BACKEND; hostname must be fifteen characters or shorter and may not start with a digit due to functional restrictions in 3rd-party software used by &BACKEND;.
VMs with Names Containing Non-ASCII Characters Cannot be Uploaded to &BACKEND;
Workaround: Only use ASCII characters in the names of VMs used with &BACKEND;.
&PB; Devices Running Versions Other Than 2.0 Cannot Connect to &BACKEND; &PRODUCT_VERSION; if Registration PIN Feature is Enabled
Issue: The registration PIN feature introduced in &BACKEND; 2.0 is not supported in &PB; versions less than 2.0.
VM Boot Can Get Progressively Slower the Higher the Version Number Gets

Issue: When you create a new version of a VM the difference between the disk of the previous version and the new version is stored in a file and the file containing the disk information of the previous verson is retained. At VM boot time these differences are resolved to form the VM disk image. The greater the number of files of differences that need to be resolved, the longer the VM can take to boot.
Incorrect Error Message Displayed if an Upload Fails Due to Lack of Network Connectivity

If a VM upload fails because no network is available, the incorrect error message is displayed. If an unexpected error message appears when attempting to perform an upload, please check that you are properly connected to a network and can access the Synchronizer.
&PB; Installer Can Take up to Three Minutes to Recognize an Invalid &BACKEND; Address
Issue: When using the Advanced Install of &PB; it can take up to three minutes for the installer to recognize that a &BACKEND; IP address is invalid. During this time the installer is unresponsive.
Workaround: Be careful to enter the correct address of the desired &BACKEND; server.
USB Webcam Policy May Not Always Be Enforced on Dell E4300
Issue: Some USB webcams are not recognized as such on a Dell E4300 device, resulting in unexpected behavior with regard to USB device policy.
